text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without
author: Gautama Buddha

text: Throw off your worries when you throw off your clothes at night
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: It is a man's own mind, not his enemy or foe, that lures him to evil ways
author: Gautama Buddha

text: Never trouble another for what you can do yourself
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: As long as you live, keep learning how to live
author: Seneca

text: Common looking people are the best in the world, that is the reason the Lord makes so many of them
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: The less one has to do, the less time one finds to do it in
author: Lord Chesterfield

text: Life is as tedious as a twice-told tale
author: William Shakespeare

text: Man is the cruelest animal
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Happiness never decreases by being shared
author: Gautama Buddha

text: The beginning is the most important part of the work
author: Plato

text: Life is a festival only to the wise
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is the flower for which love is the honey
author: Victor Hugo

text: The miserable have no other medicine but only hope
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Do not do to others what angers you if done to you by others
author: Socrates

text: What is my life if I am no longer useful to others
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled
author: Plutarch

text: The well bred contradict other people. The wise contradict themselves
author: Oscar Wilde

text: As the purse is emptied, the heart is filled
author: Victor Hugo

text: For a man to conquer himself is the first and noblest of all victories
author: Plato

text: I destroy my enemies when I make them my friends
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: He is able who think he is able
author: Gautama Buddha

text: You yourself as much as anybody in the entire universe deserve your love and affection
author: Gautama Buddha

text: He who fears being conquered is sure of defeat
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It is better to be alone than in bad company
author: George Washington

text: All great ideas are dangerous
author: Oscar Wilde

text: He who opens a school door, closes a prison
author: Victor Hugo

text: Avoid popularity if you would have peace
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: I am not afraid; I was born to do this
author: Joan of Arc

text: Love inspires, illuminates, designates and leads the way
author: Mary Baker Eddy

text: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: A superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions
author: Confucius

text: Whatever you are, be a good one
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body
author: Joseph Addison

text: The noblest pleasure is the joy of understanding
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: The value of an idea lies in the using of it
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: To love another person is to see the face of God
author: Victor Hugo

text: You must be wise, but not too wise
author: Alexander T. Stewart

text: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: I never expect to see a perfect work from an imperfect man
author: Alexander Hamilton

text: Compromise makes a good umbrella but a poor roof
author: James Russell Lowell

text: He who cannot give anything away cannot feel anything either
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: He who has conquered doubt and fear has conquered failure
author: James Lane Allen

text: Life is something that everyone should try at least once
author: Henry J. Tillman

text: Well done is better than well said
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The most useless are those who never change through the years
author: James M. Barrie

text: There is no remedy for love but to love more
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The object of the superior man is truth
author: Confucius

text: Life is a tale told by an idiot
author: full of sound and fury, signifying nothing

text: Life is ten percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it
author: Lou Holtz

text: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet
author: Aristotle

text: When words fail music speaks
author: William Shakespeare

text: Three things cannot be long hidden. the sun, the moon, and the truth
author: Gautama Buddha

text: For success, attitude is equally important as ability
author: Walter Scott

text: A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it
author: Jean de La Fontaine

text: If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader
author: John Quincy Adams

text: Positive anything is better than negative nothing
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something
author: Plato

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started
author: Mark Twain

text: Life is the continuous adjustment of internal relations to external relations
author: Herbert Spencer

text: We are shaped by our thoughts, we become what we think
author: Gautama Buddha

text: Experience is the teacher of all things
author: Julius Caesar

text: In all things of nature, there is something of the marvelous
author: Aristotle

text: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: If you suffer, thank God! It is a sure sign that you are alive
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Hell is empty and all the devils are here
author: William Shakespeare Quote

text: To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without loosing heart
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

text: Happiness is the only good. The time to be happy is now. The place to be happy is here. The way to be happy is to make others so
author: Robert Ingersoll

text: Perfection? Being the most human you can be
author: Giovanni Morassutti

text: To keep the body in good health is a duty.. Otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear
author: Gautama Buddha

text: Expectation is the root of all heartache
author: William Shakespeare

text: Nothing can stop the man with the right mental attitude from achieving his goal; nothing on earth can help the man with the wrong mental attitude
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Beware of missing chances, otherwise it may be altogether too late some day
author: Franz Liszt

text: The great aim of education is not knowledge but action
author: Herbert Spencer

text: As I grow older, I pay less attention to what men say. I just watch what they do
author: Andrew Carnegie

text: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: There is always a risk in being alive, and if you are more alive, there is more risk
author: Henrik Ibsen

text: One of the first signs of a spirit-filled life is enthusiasm
author: A. B. Simpson

text: To be good, and do good, is the whole duty of man comprised in a few words
author: Abigail Adams

text: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence of the future
author: Seneca

text: Always stand on principle, even if you stand alone
author: John Adams

text: You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and only way, it doesn't exist
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Sometimes the people with the worst past, create the best future
author: Umar ibn Al-Khattab

text: Our greatest enemies, the ones we must fight most often, are within
author: Thomas Paine

text: The future is the worst thing about the present
author: Gustave Flaubert

text: The things that we love tell us what we are
author: St. Thomas Aquinas

text: Try and fail, but don't fail to try
author: John Quincy Adams

text: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Success is not something to wait for, it is something to work for
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: Seize the moments of happiness, love and be loved! That is the only reality in the world, all else is folly
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Relationships are based on four principles respect, understanding, acceptance and appreciation
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Every experience, no matter how bad it seems, holds within it a blessing of some kind. The goal is to find it
author: Gautama Buddha

text: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: A hero is a man who does what he can
author: Romain Rolland

text: The achievement of one goal should be the starting point of another
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: Everything you say should be true, but not everything true should be said
author: Voltaire

text: I know that I am intelligent, because I know that I know nothing
author: Socrates

text: Believe only half of what you see and nothing that you hear
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: One who believes in himself has no need to convince others
author: Laozi

text: It is difficult to find happiness within oneself, but it is impossible to find it anywhere else
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: Every step we take on earth brings us to a new world
author: Federico Garcia Lorca

text: Happiness will never come to those who fail to appreciate what they already have
author: Gautama Buddha

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall
author: Confucius

text: The Flower that smells the sweetest is shy and lowly
author: William Wordsworth

text: We do not really think, we are barely conscious, until something goes wrong
author: Charles Sanders Peirce

text: If you cannot live alone, you were born a slave
author: Fernando Pessoa

text: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see
author: Mark Twain

text: A wise man speaks because he has something to say; a fool because he has to say something
author: Plato

text: Life is like cup of tea, the sugar is all at the bottom!
author: Julia Ward Howe

text: No man truly has joy unless he lives in love
author: St. Thomas Aquinas

text: By failing to prepare you are preparing to fail
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime
author: Maimonides

text: See all living beings as your father or mother, and love them as if you were their child
author: Atisa

text: It is better to act and repent than not act and regret
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: After the verb 'to Love', 'to Help' is the most beautiful verb in the world
author: Bertha von Suttner

text: The only thing more dangerous than ignorance is arrogance
author: Albert Einstein

text: You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Think for yourself, or others will think for you without thinking of you
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Do not judge yourself harshly. Without mercy for ourselves we cannot love the world
author: Gautama Buddha

text: Go wisely and slowly. Those who rush stumble and fall
author: William Shakespeare

text: Hope is nature's veil for hiding truth's nakedness
author: Alfred Nobel

text: Our greatest ability as humans is not to change the world; but to change ourselves
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Take what you need, do what you should, you will get what you want
author: Gottfried Leibniz

text: I’m a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it…
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts…
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Things turn out best for people who make the best of the way things turn out…
author: John Wooden

text: Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen…
author: Michael Jordan

text: Strive to be first: First to nod, First to smile, First to compliment, and first to forgive…
author: Author Unknown

text: To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest…
author: Pema Chodron

text: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree…
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Inspiration and genius, one and the same…
author: Victor Hugo

text: The world is full of suffering. It is also full of overcoming it…
author: Helen Keller

text: Each day, accept everything that comes to you as a gift. At night, mentally give it all back. In this way, you become free…
author: Daniel Levin

text: In any moment of decision the best thing you can do is the right thing, the next best thing is the wrong thing, and the worst thing you can do is nothing…
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Try not to become a man of success but a man of value…
author: Albert Einstein

text: Do we not all agree to call rapid thought and noble impulse by the name of inspiration?…
author: George Eliot

text: Never tell me the sky is the limit when there are footprints on the moon…
author: Author Unknown

text: Everyday is a gift, which is why they call it the present…
author: Alfred Hitchcock

text: Your success and happiness lie in you…
author: Helen Keller

text: It’s never too late to get back on your feet though we won’t live forever. Make sure you accomplish what you were put here for…
author: Abigail Adams

text: You jump off a cliff and you assemble an airplane on the way down…
author: Reid Hoffman

text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do…
author: Epictetus

text: The more difficulties one has to encounter, within and without, the more significant and the higher in inspiration his life will be…
author: Horace Bushnell

text: In chaos, there is fertility…
author: Anais Nin

text: Believe in yourself!.. Have faith in your abilities!.. Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers, you cannot be successful or happy…
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: We think too small, like the frog at the bottom of the well. He thinks the sky is only as big as the top of the well. If he surfaced, he would have an entirely different view…
author: Mao Tse-Tung

text: Forever – is composed of nows…
author: Emily Dickinson

text: No man can tell whether he is rich or poor by turning to his ledger. It is the heart that makes a man rich. He is rich according to what he is, not according to what he has…
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: Better keep yourself clean and bright; you are the window through which you must see the world…
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Anyone can hold the helm when the sea is calm…
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Bringing up the past only if it will help to build the future, otherwise it’s best to be left to sleep…
author: Tahir M. Khan

text: Never fear shadows. They simply mean there’s a light shining somewhere nearby…
author: Ruth E. Renkel

text: Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair…
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Step through new doors. The majority of the time there’s something fantastic on the other side…
author: Terry Mindock

text: The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is that little extra…
author: Jimmy Johnson

text: After a storm, comes a calm…
author: Matthew Henry

text: We are still masters of our fate. We are still captains of our souls…
author: Winston Churchill

text: There is something simply beautiful and simply innocent, in being human. It is just so innocent and beautiful. I love it…
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: It doesn’t matter where you are, you are nowhere compared to where you can go…
author: Bob Proctor

text: Always be a first rate version of yourself, instead of a second rate version of somebody else…
author: Judy Garland

text: Nobody gets to live life backward. Look ahead, that is where your future lies…
author: Ann Landers

text: Follow your honest convictions, and stay strong…
author: William Thackeray

text: No winter lasts forever, and no spring skips its turn…
author: Hal Borland

text: It is better to take many small steps in the right direction than to make a great leap forward only to stumble backward…
author: Louis Sachar

text: The only journey is the journey within…
author: Lord Chesterfield

text: Wisdom is knowing what to do next, skill is knowing how to do it, and virtue is doing it…
author: David Starr Jordan

text: Yesterday I was sad, today I am happy! Yesterday I had a problem, today I still have the same problem! But today I changed the way I look at it…
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: see beyond the eyes can see, believe beyond the inspiration…
author: Felix Y. Siauw

text: A diamond is just a piece of charcoal that handled stress exceptionally well…
author: Author Unknown

text: Your present circumstances don’t determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start…
author: Nido Qubein

text: If you have built castles in the air, your work need not be lost. That is where they should be. Now put foundations under them…
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: If the facts don’t fit the theory, change the fact…
author: Albert Einstein

text: In a gentle way, you can shake the world…
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful…
author: Sigmund Freud

text: It was only sunny smile, and little it cost in the giving, but like morning light it scattered the night and made the day worth living…
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world can not be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart…
author: Helen Keller

text: Don’t ask yourself what the world needs, ask yourself what makes you come alive. and then go do that. Because what the world needs is people who have come alive…
author: Howard Thurman

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been…
author: George Eliot

text: When you can’t change the direction of the wind.. adjust your sails…
author: H. Jackson Brown

text: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all…
author: Dale Carnegie

text: A light heart lives long…
author: William Shakespeare

text: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky…
author: Rabindranath Tagore

text: You can only grow if you’re willing to feel awkward and uncomfortable when you try something new…
author: Brian Tracy

text: The wound is the place where the light enters you…
author: Rumi

text: Show me your hands. Do they have scars from giving?.. Show me your feet. Are they wounded in service?.. Show me your heart. Have you left a place for divine love?…
author: Fulton J. Sheen

text: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none…
author: William Shakespeare

text: It is not enough to stare up the steps; we must step up the stairs…
author: Vaclav Havel

text: There is a crack in everything. That’s how the light gets in…
author: Adam Selzer

text: Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple…
author: Dr. Seuss

text: When you have a sense of your own identity and a vision of where you want to go in your life, you then have the basis for reaching out to the world and going after your dreams for a better life…
author: Stedman Graham

text: It’s easier to go down a hill than up it but the view is much better at the top…
author: Arnold Bennett

text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars…
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending…
author: Carl Bard

text: All men are prepared to accomplish the incredible if their ideals are threatened…
author: Maya Angelo

text: By lifting the weakest, poorest among us, we lift the rest of us as well…
author: Bill Clinton

text: Old enough to know better, young enough to try it again…
author: Author Unknown

text: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: In the right light, at the right time, everything is extraordinary…
author: Aaron Rose

text: What is meant to be will always find a way…
author: Trisha Yearwood

text: Anything I’ve done that was ultimately worthwhile initially scared me to death…
author: Betty Bender

text: When you come to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on…
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: If a man does his best, what else is there?…
author: George S. Patton

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Never, if possible, lie down at night without being able to say: I have made one human being, at least, a little wiser, a little happier, or a little better this day…
author: Charles Kingsley

text: Don’t say you don’t have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo Da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson and Albert Einstein…
author: H. Jackson Brown

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall…
author: Nelson Mandela

text: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think…
author: A. A. Milne

text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life. Don’t be trapped by dogma – which is living with the results of other people’s thinking. Don’t let the noise of other’s opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow already know what you truly want to become. Everything else is secondary…
author: Steve Jobs

text: There is something beautiful about all scars of whatever nature. A scar means the hurt is over, the wound is closed and healed, done with…
author: Harry Crews

text: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind…
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending…
author: Maria Robinson

text: In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock…
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Have respect for yourself, and patience and compassion. With these, you can handle anything…
author: Jack Kornfield

text: At the end of the day, it’s not about what you have or even what you’ve accomplished. It’s about what you’ve done with those accomplishments. It’s about who you’ve lifted up, who you’ve made better. It’s about what you’ve given back…
author: Denzel Washington

text: All mankind is divided into three classes: those that are immovable, those that are movable, and those that move…
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Water continually dropping will wear hard rocks hollow…
author: Plutarch

text: Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit…
author: Bern Williams

text: It is during our darkest movements that we must focus to see the light…
author: Aristotle Onassis

text: It is interesting to notice how some minds seem almost to create themselves, springing up under every disadvantage, and working their solitary but irresistible way through a thousand obstacles…
author: Washington Irving

text: The word impossible is not in my dictionary…
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: He who never fell, never climbed…
author: Author Unknown

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take…
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Don’t wish it was easier wish you were better…
author: Jim Rohn

text: You’re never as good as everyone tells you when you win, and you’re never as bad as they say when you lose…
author: Lou Holtz

text: The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection…
author: Thomas Paine

text: There is always room for a man of force and he makes room for many. Society is a troop of thinkers and the best heads among them take the best places…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The significance of a man is not in what he attains, but rather what he longs to attain…
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Within each of us lies the power of our consent to health and sickness, to riches and poverty, to freedom and to slavery. It is we who control these, and not another…
author: Richard Bach

text: Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel…
author: Augustus Hare

text: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm…
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: To climb steep hills, requires a slow pace at first…
author: William Shakespeare

text: The whales do not sing because they have an answer, they sing because they have a song…
author: Gregory Colbert

text: Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have…
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: We delight in the beauty of the butterfly, but rarely admit the changes it has gone through to achieve that beauty…
author: Maya Angelou

text: History shows us that the people who end up changing the world.. the great political, social, scientific, technological, artistic, even sports revolutionaries.. are always nuts, until they are right, and then they are geniuses…
author: John Eliot

text: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak…
author: Sun Tzu

text: You must know for which harbor you are headed if you are to catch the right wind to take you there…
author: Seneca

text: Seeing a miracle will inspire you, but knowing you are a miracle will change you…
author: Deborah Brodie

text: If you desire to blossom like a rose in the garden, first learn the art of adjusting to the thorns…
author: Author Unknown

text: Few are those who see with their own eyes and feel with their own hearts…
author: Albert Einstein

text: Do not yearn to be popular; be exquisite. Do not desire to be famous; be loved. Do not take pride in being expected; be palpable, unmistakable…
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves…
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: One must maintain a little bit of summer, even in the middle of winter…
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Take it easy, but take it…
author: Woody Guthrie

text: Seek the lofty by reading, hearing and seeing great work at some moment every day…
author: Thornton Wilder

text: All the effort in the world won’t matter if you’re not inspired…
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: Kites rise highest against the wind, not with it…
author: Winston Churchill

text: Fully embrace the now, no matter what the situation…
author: Patrick Flynn

text: Don’t think outside the box, think like there is no box…
author: Author Unknown

text: We do not need magic to change the world, we carry all the power need inside ourselves already…
author: J. K. Rowling

text: Everyone has a fair turn to be as great as he pleases…
author: Jeremy Collier

text: Every day may not be good, but there is something good in everyday…
author: Author Unknown

text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step…
author: Lao Tzu

text: I know for sure that what we dwell on is who we become…
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago…
author: Warren Buffett

text: True beauty is not related to what color your hair is or what color your eyes are. True beauty is about who you are as a human being, your principles, your moral compass…
author: Ellen DeGeneres

text: If you’re lazy, you compare your self with the worst. If you’re hard working, you compare your self with the best. If you’re happy however, people compare themselves with you…
author: Author Unknown

text: He who cuts his own wood, warms himself twice…
author: Bill Kassis

text: A true man hates no one…
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life. Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement…
author: Golda Meir

text: Leave to the masters of art trained by a lifetime of devotion the wonderful process of picture-building and picture creation. Go out into the sunlight and be happy with what you see…
author: Winston Churchill

text: Be interesting, be enthusiastic.. and don’t talk too much…
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: The major difference between the big shot and the little shot is the big shot is just a little shot who kept on shooting…
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Sometimes the biggest problem is in your head. You’ve got to believe you can play a shot instead of wondering where your next bad shot is coming from…
author: Jack Nicklaus

text: Our wounds are often the openings into the best and most beautiful part of us…
author: David Richo

text: Blessed is the man who admires without being jealous, praises without flattery, follows without imitating, and leads without manipulating…
author: Author Unknown

text: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do…
author: Pope John XXIII

text: Others can stop you temporarily. You are the only one who can do it permanently…
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Without inspiration the best powers of the mind remain dormant, there is a fuel in us which needs to be ignited with sparks…
author: Johann Gottfried Von Herder

text: Nothing great is created suddenly, any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig…
author: Epictetus

text: Empty pockets never held anyone back. Only empty heads and empty hearts can do that…
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Pray, forgive yourself, appreciate others, listen to your gut, do things you enjoy, and remind yourself that we are all loved and connected…
author: Sandra Lumb

text: You have to have the darkness for the dawn to come…
author: Harrison Ford

text: Wake at dawn with a winged heart and give thanks for another day of loving…
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: If I advance, follow me. If I stop, push me. If I fall, inspire me…
author: Robert Cushing

text: Love yourself – accept yourself – forgive yourself – and be good to yourself, because without you the rest of us are without a source of many wonderful things…
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: If you can’t do great things, do small things in a great way…
author: Napoleon Hill

text: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators…
author: Edward Gibbon

text: Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight…
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit…
author: Aristotle

text: Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death…
author: Rumi

text: It is only in sorrow bad weather masters us; in joy we face the storm and defy it…
author: Amelia Barr

text: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you’ll land among the stars…
author: Brian Littrell

text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones…
author: Confucius

text: The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do…
author: Steve Jobs

text: We are all inventors, each sailing out on a voyage of discovery, guided each by a private chart, of which there is no duplicate. The world is all gates, all opportunities…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror…
author: Edith Wharton

text: Live every day as if it’s your last, embracing each experience as if it’s your first…
author: Jennifer Fertado

text: There are over 7 billion people on earth and you’re going to let 1 person ruin your day?.. Don’t…
author: Author Unknown

text: The good is the enemy of the best. Until you depart from the good, you cannot enter God’s best for your life…
author: Pedro Okoro

text: Let your life mean something. Become an inspiration to others so that they may try to do more and to become more than they are today…
author: Thomas D. Willhite

text: The person who tries to live alone will not succeed as a human being. His heart withers if it does not answer another heart. His mind shrinks away if he hears only the echoes of his own thoughts and finds no other inspiration…
author: Pearl S. Buck

text: My formula for living is quite simple. I get up in the morning and I go to bed at night. In between, I occupy myself as best I can…
author: Cary Grant

text: Regardless of who you are or what you have been, you can be what you want to be…
author: W. Clement Stone

text: It’s not enough that we do our best; sometimes we have to do what’s required…
author: Winston Churchill

text: Skill and confidence are an unconquered army…
author: George Herbert

text: The message is clear: plan with attitude, prepare with aptitude, participate with servitude, receive with gratitude, and this should be enough to separate you from the multitudes…
author: Krish Dhanam

text: What’s real doesn’t fade away…
author: Author Unknown

text: You cannot find peace by avoiding life…
author: Virginia Woolf

text: What comes out of you when you are squeezed is what is inside of you…
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Few people know how to take a walk. The qualifications are endurance, plain clothes, old shoes, an eye for nature, good humor, vast curiosity, good speech, good silence and nothing too much…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It’s nice to be important, but it’s more important to be nice…
author: John Cassis

text: Everything you are against weakens you. Everything you are for empowers you…
author: Wayne Dyer

text: If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it…
author: Lucy Larcom

text: Confront the dark parts of yourself, and work to banish them with illumination and forgiveness. Your willingness to wrestle with your demons will cause your angels to sing. Use the pain as fuel, as a reminder of your strength…
author: August Wilson

text: Hitch your wagon to a star…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The way I see it, if you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain…
author: Dolly Parton

text: New beginnings are often disguised as painful endings…
author: Lao Tzu

text: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering…
author: Ben Okri

text: Among the things you can give and still keep are your word, a smile, and a grateful heart…
author: Zig Ziglar

text: You’re alive. Do something. The directive in life, the moral imperative was so uncomplicated. It could be expressed in single words, not complete sentences. It sounded like this: Look. Listen. Choose. Act…
author: Barbara Hall

text: With every rising of the sun, Think of your life as just begun…
author: Ella Wheeler

text: The heights by great men reached and kept were not attained by sudden flight, but they while their companions slept, were toiling upward in the night…
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: If you can imagine it, you can achieve it; if you can dream it, you can become it…
author: William Arthur Ward

text: The golden moments in the stream of life rush past us, and we see nothing but sand; the angels come to visit us, and we only know them when they are gone…
author: George Eliot

text: Choose your friends with caution; plan your future with purpose, and frame your life with faith…
author: Thomas S. Monson

text: You can be powerful, different and unique all at the same time…
author: Gregg Braden

text: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much…
author: Helen Keller

text: Reflect upon your present blessings, of which every man has plenty; not on your past misfortunes of which all men have some…
author: Charles Dickens

text: Real elation is when you feel you could touch a star without standing on tiptoe…
author: Doug Larson

text: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them…
author: John C. Maxwell

text: As we work to create light for others, we naturally light our own way…
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

text: The best preparation for tomorrow is to do today’s work superbly well…
author: William Osler

text: Reach high, for stars lie hidden in your soul. Dream deep, for every dream precedes the goal…
author: Pamela Vaull Starr

text: If you had started doing anything two weeks ago, by today you would have been two weeks better at it…
author: John Mayer

text: Those who dance are called insane by those who don’t hear the music…
author: Eddie Vedder

text: There is always a better way…
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Broken wings are not useless, because they still hold the memories of being able to fly…
author: Yukito Kunisaki Anime

text: We are motivated by a keen desire for praise, and the better a man is the more he is inspired by glory…
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: Begin doing what you want to do now. We are not living in eternity. We have only this moment, sparkling like a star in our hand, and melting like a snowflake…
author: Francis Bacon

text: Without ambition one starts nothing. Without work one finishes nothing. The prize will not be sent to you. You have to win it…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: What chance gathers she easily scatters. A great person attracts great people and knows how to hold them together…
author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe

text: There is nothing so rewarding as to make people realize that they are worthwhile in this world…
author: Bob Anderson

text: Be the type of person you want to meet…
author: Author Unknown

text: Ask and it will be given to you; search and you will find; knock and the will be opened for you…
author: Jesus Christ

text: Make everyday count, appreciate and cherish every moment and grab everything you possibly can because you may never be able to experience it again…
author: Kemmy Nola

text: A hero is born among a hundred, a wise man is found among a thousand, but an accomplished one might not be found even among a hundred thousand men…
author: Plato

text: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise…
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: There is seed time and harvest, choose to sow at the right time so as to have a bountiful harvest…
author: Jaachynma N. E. Agu

text: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone…
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: A beautiful day starts with you. Remember to begin it with a smile…
author: Venkat Desireddy

text: Snowflakes are one of nature’s most fragile things, but just look what they can do when they stick together…
author: Author Unknown

text: Hold on to whatever keeps you warm inside. Trust me, it’s something that is too hard to find…
author: Such Gold

text: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money…
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing…
author: Aristotle

text: Only in the darkness can you see the stars…
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning…
author: Albert Einstein

text: Obstacles are necessary for success because in selling, as in all careers of importance, victory comes only after many struggles and countless defeats…
author: Og Mandino

text: Laugh when you can, apologize when you should, and let go of what you can’t change…
author: Author Unknown

text: Laugh as much as you breathe and love as long as you live…
author: Johnny Depp

text: Follow your heart but take your brain with you…
author: Alfred Adler

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can…
author: Arthur Ashe

text: If we do not destroy ourselves, we will one day venture to the stars…
author: Carl Sagan

text: If you’re offered a seat on a rocket ship, don’t ask what seat. Just get on…
author: Sheryl Sandberg

text: The question isn’t who is going to let me; it’s who is going to stop me…
author: Ayn Rand

text: Let others lead small lives, but not you.. Let others argue over small things, but not you.. Let others cry over small hurts, but not you.. Let others leave their future in someone else’s hands, but not you…
author: Jim Rohn

text: A small body of determined spirits fired by an unquenchable faith in their mission can alter the course of history…
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Inspiration does exist, but it must find you working…
author: Pablo Picasso

text: You can’t fall if you don’t climb, but there’s no joy in living your whole life on the ground…
author: Author Unknown

text: Every day is a journey filled with twists and turns. Every day, if you smile, you will feel alive…
author: Santosh Kalwar

text: I find hope in the darkest of days, and focus in the brightest. I do not judge the universe…
author: Dalai Lama

text: Good, Better, Best. Never let it rest. Till your good is better and your better is best…
author: St. Jerome

text: To look forward and not back, To look out and not in, and To lend a hand…
author: Edward Everett Hale

text: To do great things, a person needs invariably his heart pain to activate his human brain to train his life to remain unrestrained to do only the activity that soothes his soul…
author: Anuj Somany

text: Nothing stops the man who desires to achieve. Every obstacle is simply a course to develop his achievement muscle. It’s a strengthening of his powers of accomplishment…
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us…
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success…
author: Swami Sivananda

text: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door…
author: Milton Berle

text: One today is worth two tomorrows…
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing…
author: Walt Disney

text: Our life is shaped by our mind; we become what we think. Joy follows a pure thought like a shadow that never leaves…
author: Gautama Buddha

text: If you have a dream, don’t just sit there. Gather courage to believe that you can succeed and leave no stone unturned to make it a reality…
author: Roopleen

text: Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine…
author: Anthony J. D’Angelo

text: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud…
author: Maya Angelou

text: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you…
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: If you believe in yourself and have dedication and pride - and never quit, you'll be a winner. The price of victory is high but so are the rewards…
author: Paul Bryant

text: Whatever your life’s work is, do it well. A man should do his job so well that the living, the dead, and the unborn could do it no better…
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Work hard. Laugh when you feel like crying. Keep an open mind, open eyes and an open spirit…
author: Rachael Ray

text: Keep your fears to yourself, but share your courage with others…
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Everyone has highs and lows that they have to learn from, but every morning I start off with a good head on my shoulders, saying to myself, ‘It’s going to be a good day…
author: Lindsay Lohan

text: Smile when it hurts most…
author: Author Unknown

text: Perhaps our eyes need to be washed by our tears once in a while, so that we can see Life with a clearer view again…
author: Alex Tan

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there…
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: What we think, we become…
author: Gautama Buddha

text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!…
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you…
author: Walt Whitman

text: A champion is someone who gets up when he can't…
author: Jack Dempsey

text: When it is dark enough, you can see the star.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: When you're feeling your worst, that's when you get to know yourself the best.
author: Leslie Grossman

text: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
author: Buddha

text: Bad is never good until worse happens.
author: Danish Proverb

text: Don't look where you fall, but where you slipped.
author: African Proverb

text: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Men are made stronger on realization that the helping hand they need is at the end of their own arm
author: Sidney J. Phillips

text: If you think sunshine brings you happiness, then you haven't danced in the rain.
God brings men into deep waters, not to drown them, but to cleanse them.
author: John Aughey

text: Worrying won't stop the bad stuff from happening. It just stops you from enjoying the good.
Do something special for someone today: just give them a smile and you will be amazed at how much of a difference it makes
Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Let your smile change the world, but don't let the world change your smile.
Be thankful for what you have and you will end up having more.
author: Oprah

text: You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to swim.
author: Jon Kabat Zinn

text: Think positive, feel positive, and positive things will happen.
Just when the caterpillar though its world was over, it became a butterfly.
When you are at peace you attract positive energy.
Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Ghandi

text: A bird sitting on a tree is never afraid of the branch breaking, because her trust is not on the branch but on it's wings. Always believe in yourself.
Always find time for the things that make you feel happy to be alive.
Don't compare your life to others. There is no comparison between the sun and the moon. They shine when it's their time.
Silence and smile are two very powerful tools. Smile is the way to solve many problems. Silence is the way to avoid many problems.
Fear is a reaction. Courage is a decision.
Love is caring for each other even when you're angry
It's you road, and yours alone. Others may walk it with you, but no one can walk it for you.
author: Rumi

text: Enjoy the little things in life, because one day you'll look back and realize they were the big things.
A smart person knows what to say. A wise person knows whether or not to say it.

One day it just clicks. You realize what's important and what isn't. You learn to care less about what other people thing, and more about what you think of yourself. You realize how far you've come and you remember when you thought things were such a mess that you would never recover. And you smile. You smile because you are truly proud of yourself and the person you've fought to become.
People will throw rocks at you. Don't throw them back. Collect them all and build an empire.

If you are struggling today, remember this. You have survived everything you've gone through up to this point. The best day of your life is still yet to come. There are still people you haven't met, and things you haven't experienced. You can do this.
Your first through in the morning should be 'Thank you'.
You get what you focus on, so focus on what you want.
Accept what is, let go of what was, and have faith in what will be.
Nothing is permanent. Don't stress yourself too much because no matter how bad the situation is... it will change.
Be strong now, because things will get better. It might be stormy now, but it can't rain forever.
Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
No matter how good or bad your life is, wake up each morning and be thankful that you still have one.
Life is better when you cry a little, laugh a lot, and are thankful for everything you've got.
My goal is not to be better than anyone else, but to be better than I used to be.
author: Dr Wayne W. Dyer

text: Life is like a book. Some chapters are sad, some are happy, and some are exciting. But if you never turn the page, you will never know what the next chapter holds.
When life gives you a hundred reasons to break down and cry, show life that you have a million reasons to smile and laugh. Stay strong.
No matter how long you have traveled in the wrong direction, you can always turn around.
Anger is a punishment we give to ourself, for somebody else's mistake.
You never know how strong you are, until being strong is the only choice you have.
One day you will tell your story of how you've overcome what you're going through now, and it will become part of someone else's survival guide.
Never blame anyone in your life. The good people give you happiness. The bad people give you experience. The worst people give you a lesson. The best people give you memories.
If you can't do anything about it, then let it go. Don't be a prisoner to things you can't change.
author: Tony Gaskins

text: Two things define you. Your patience when you have nothing, and your attitude when you have everything.
Nothing is more beautiful than a real smile that has struggled through tears.
Sun is alone too, but still shines.
To make a difference in someone's life you don't have to be brilliant, rich, beautiful or perfect. You just have to care.
author: Mandy Hale

text: If someone is stupid enough to walk away from you, be smart enough to let them go.
No one in this world is pure and perfect. If you avoid people for their mistakes you will always be alone. So judge less and love more.
At the end of the day, all that really matters is that your loved ones are well, you've done your best, and that you're thankful for all you have.
As i look back on my life, I realize that every time I though I was being rejected from something good, I was actually being re-directed to something better.
If you have to choose between being kind and being right, choose being kind and you will always be right.
Don't start your day with the broken pieces of yesterday. Every day is a fresh start. Each day is a new beginning. Every morning we wake up is the first day of our new life.
Never be a prisoner of your past. It was just a lesson, not a life sentence.
The happiest people are the givers, not the takers.
Your faith can move mountains, and your doubt can create them.
Life doesn't allow for us to go back and fix what we have done wrong, but it does allow for us to live each day better than our last.

Remember, most of your stress comes from the way you respond, not the way life is. Adjust your attitude. Change how you see things. Look for the good in all situations. Take the lesson and find new opportunities to grow. Let all the extra stress, worrying and overthinking go.
Do everything with a good heart and expect nothing in return, and you will never be disappointed.
Everytime you get upset at something, ask yourself if you were to die tomorrow, was it worth wasting your time being angry?
Love what you have, before life teaches you to love what you lost.
There will always be someone who can't see your worth. Don't let it be you.
author: Mel Robbins

text: Confidence is not 'They will like me'. Confidence is 'I'll be fine if they don't'.
If you get tired, learn to rest, not to quit.
The more you are thankful, the more you attract things to be thankful for.
You can't control everything. Sometimes you just need to relax and have faith that things will work out. Let go  a little and just let life happen.
author: Kody Keplinger

text: Smiling doesn't necessarily mean you're happy. Sometimes it just means you're strong.
Confidence isn't thinking you're better than everyone else, it's realizing that you have no reason to compare yourself to anyone else.
Sometimes the smallest stop in the right direction ends up being the biggest step of your life. Tip toe if you must, but take the step.
Never regret a day in your life: Good days give you happiness, bad days give experience, worst days give lessons, and best days give memories.
If an egg is broken by outside force, life ends. If broken by an inside force, life begins. Great things always begin from the inside.
No matter how educated, talented, rich or cool you believe you are, how you treat people ultimately tells all. Integrity is everything.
Sometimes the best things you can do is to not thing, not wonder, not imagine, and not obsess. Just breathe, and have faith that everything will work out for the best.
Never reply when you are angry. Never make a promise when you are happy. Never make a decision when you are sad.
Life is the most difficult exam. Many people fail because they try to copy others, not realizing that everyone has a different question paper.
